title: Man charged with OUI after allegedly driving the wrong way for 3 miles on I-95 through Newburyport
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The driver, 36-year-old Paulius Balciunas of Worcester, was also charged with resisting arrest after leading police on a 30-minute pursuit through several North Shore communities.

A Worcester man is facing multiple charges after state police say he drove the wrong way for nearly three miles on Interstate 95 near Newburyport on Christmas night and led officers on a 30-minute pursuit through several North Shore communities.

Paulius Balciunas, 36, was arraigned Friday in Newburyport District Court on charges including operating a vehicle under the influence of drugs, failure to stop for police, resisting arrest, negligent operation of a motor vehicle, driving in the breakdown lane, and speeding, according to a report by The Boston Globe.

title: Taunton man charged with animal cruelty after emaciated puppy allegedly found in car
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The 9-month-old puppy, named Sprout, is slowly recovering from malnourishment at the APCSM.
A Taunton man is facing animal cruelty charges after police say they discovered a severely emaciated puppy in his car during a routine traffic stop in West Bridgewater.
Devin Preeper, 27, was arraigned Tuesday in Brockton District Court on a felony charge of animal cruelty in connection with the severe malnourishment of his pug-mix puppy.

title: Former MBTA cleaner charged in theft of more than $120,000 in equipment
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Investigators allegedly traced the stolen equipment back to the T employee after searching eBay.

A former MBTA employee is due back in court next month after being charged in connection with the theft and resale of more than $120,000 worth of network equipment from the agency’s IT department, the Suffolk District Attorney’s Office announced.
Marcelo Batista-Sales, 39, of Lynn, was arraigned Nov.

title: 2 dead in Friday morning crash
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News A third person is in critical condition following the early-morning crash in Barre.
Two people were killed, and a third was critically injured in a single-vehicle crash early Friday morning in Barre, according to local authorities.

title: Officials give update on deadly Christmas Eve fire in Needham
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Investigators believe that the blaze, which killed a 21-year-old woman, was accidental.
Firefighters worked at the scene of a house fire on Woodworth Road in Needham on Wednesday morning.
Natick Fire Department Officials gave an update Friday on the investigation surrounding a deadly Christmas Eve fire that occurred in Needham.
